text: Leptomantis, or slim treefrogs, is a group of frogs that live in southern Thailand and the Philippines. Scientists used to think the frogs in the genus Leptomantis were in Rhacophorus. ==Species== These species are in the genus Leptomantis: * Leptomantis angulirostris (Ahl, 1927) * Leptomantis belalongensis (Dehling and Grafe, 2008) * Leptomantis bimaculatus Peters, 1867 * Leptomantis cyanopunctatus (Manthey and Steiof, 1998) * Leptomantis fasciatus (Boulenger, 1895) * Leptomantis gadingensis (Das and Haas, 2005) * Leptomantis gauni (Inger, 1966) * Leptomantis harrissoni (Inger and Haile, 1959) * Leptomantis malkmusi (Dehling, 2015) * Leptomantis penanorum (Dehling, 2008) * Leptomantis pseudacutirostris (Dehling, 2011) * Leptomantis robinsonii (Boulenger, 1903) * Leptomantis rufipes (Inger, 1966) ==References== Category:Frogs of Asia
title: Leptomantis
